lines.content: * Represents the DUKE chatbot each Duke object contains a Storage,
* Parser class to manage user inputs
* List of commands that the user can enter
* Parses the command entered by the user and prints out the output required
* @return true if the command is by, else returns false
System.out.println("oops the description of a todo cannot be empty!");
throw new DukeException("please specify which item to delete");
* Represents the storage component of the Duke chatbot. The Storage class handles then reading and writing
* of the file that stores the content of the Duke chatbot. Each Storage object contains a
* loads the file that is contained in the storage object
* @return File object that is contained in the Storage object
* Writes the contents in the tasklist into the save file
* Represents the list of tasks that the user has keyed in.
* Constructor Method for the TaskList, if a file is given to it
* Constructor Method for the TaskList if no save file is given
* Prints out the contents of the list
* Marks the content at index as done on the list
System.out.println("I have marked this task as done:");
* Adds a new Event to the list
System.out.println("Now you have " + count + " tasks in the list");
* Adds a new Todo to the list
System.out.println("Now you have " + count + " tasks in the list");
* Adds a new Deadline to the list
System.out.println("Now you have " + count + " tasks in the list");
* Removes the task at index from the list
System.out.println("Noted. I have removed this task: \n" + item);
System.out.println("You now have " + count + " tasks left in the list");
* Marks the task at index as not done
System.out.println("I have marked this task as not done:");
* Finds any task that contains the string s in its description and prints it out.
* Represents the User Interface that users will be communicating with when using the Duke Chatbot
* Constructor Method for the Ui class
* Initialises the Ui of the Duke Chatbot
* Prints out an error statement if there are issues running the code
System.out.println("ERROR: No File Found... \nCreating New File");
* Represents a Task that also has a deadline to it. Each Deadline object contains a
* Constructor Method of the Deadline class
* Constructor Method of the Deadline class
public Deadline(boolean isDone, String description, LocalDate time) {
* Converts the Deadline object to a string
* Converts Deadline Object to a string that will be stored in a file
* @return  condensed String represenation of Deadline Object
* Represents an event in the task list
public Event(boolean isDone, String description, String time) {
* Converts Event Object to a String to be stored in a file
* @return condensed String representation of Event object
* Represents a Task on the task list
* Gets the status of the task, whether it is done or not, in a string
* @return X if task is done or " " if task is not
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Converts task to String to be stored in a file
* @return condensed String representation of Task Object
* Represents a todo item in a task list
* Converts Todo Object into a string to be stored in a file
* @return condensed String representation of Todo Object
Parser p = new Parser(new Storage("./tests/test.txt"), new TaskList());
